SEARCH
Package inf101.chess.model

Interface IChessBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChessBoard
public interface IChessBoard
An interface for chess boards. The board should always be 8x8 unless when testing.

  • Method Details

    • setPiece

      void setPiece(Location loc, Piece piece)
      Used to set a piece at a position.
      Parameters:
      loc - the position to set
      piece - the piece to set at position

    • initializeBoard

      void initializeBoard()
      Initializes a standard chess board. That is, it sets up 8 pawns for each side, 2 bishops, rooks, and knights and a single queen and king.

    • clearBoard

      void clearBoard()
      Clears the board so that it can be re-initialized for a new game.

    • copy

      IChessBoard copy()
      Copies to a new chess board.
      Returns:
      the new chess board

    • get

      Piece get(Location loc)
      Returns the piece at the position.
      Parameters:
      loc - the position to get
      Returns:
      the Piece

    • getPlayerChar

      char getPlayerChar(Location loc)
      Returns the player character which the piece at the position belongs to.
      Parameters:
      loc - the position to get
      Returns:
      player character 'W' or 'B'

    • numRows

      int numRows()
      Returns the number of rows on the chess board. Should always be 8.
      Returns:
      integer representing number of rows

    • numColumns

      int numColumns()
      Returns the number of columns on the chess board. Should always be 8.
      Returns:
      integer representing number of columns

    • squareEmpty

      boolean squareEmpty(Location loc)
      Method to determine if something exists on a given square
      Parameters:
      loc - the location to check
      Returns:
      true if the given location is empty

    • isOpponent

      boolean isOpponent(char ownChar, Location loc)
      Checks if an opposing piece exists on a square.
      Parameters:
      ownChar - the current player's char
      loc - the location to check
      Returns:
      boolean indicating if the piece at the location belongs to opponent

    • movePiece

      void movePiece(Location from, Location to)
      Move piece found at location from to location to.
      Parameters:
      from -
      to -

    • locations

      GridLocationIterator locations()
      Returns an iterator over all squares on the board.

    • countValue

      int countValue(char playerChar)
      Counts the value of pieces on the board for a given player.
      Parameters:
      playerChar - the colour of the player to count for

    • isOnBoard

      boolean isOnBoard(Location loc)
      Checks if given location is on the board.
      Parameters:
      loc - the location to check
      Returns:
      boolean indicating true or false
